Package it.unipr.sowide.actodes.service.logging

Class Logger

java.lang.Object
it.unipr.sowide.actodes.service.logging.Logger
All Implemented Interfaces:
Service, Serializable
public final class Logger
extends Object
implements Service
The Logger class logs information about the activities of an actor space. It allows to log: errors, message reception and sending, actor creation and remotion, message and timeout processing, behavior change, number of created actors, and execution time. Note that it always logs the error messages. Its implementation is based on the Java Logging API.
See Also:
java.util.logging, Serialized Form

      public void addWriter​(Writer w)
      Adds a logging writer.
      Parameters:
      w - the writer.

    • removeHandler

      public void removeHandler​(Handler h)
      Removes a logging handler.
      Parameters:
      h - the handler.

    • shutdown

      public void shutdown()
      Shutdown the logger.

    • getFilter

      public int getFilter()
      Gets the logging filter value.
      Returns:
      the value.

    • setFilter

      public void setFilter​(int f)
      Sets the logging filter value.
      Parameters:
      f - the value.

    • logError

      public void logError​(Reference r, Exception e)
      Logs an execution error.
      Parameters:
      r - the actor / actor space reference.
      e - the relative exception.

    • logConfiguration

      public void logConfiguration()
      Logs the configuration of the actor space. Note that the log is done only if the logging filter enables it.

    • logActorCreation

      public void logActorCreation​(Behavior b, Reference n, String c)
      Logs the creation of an actor.
      Parameters:
      b - the parent behavior.
      n - the child reference.
      c - the child behavior class qualified name. Note that the log is done only if the logging filter enables it.

    • logBehaviorStart

      public void logBehaviorStart​(Behavior b)
      Logs the creation of the first behavior of an actor and the starting of its initialization.
      Parameters:
      b - the behavior. Note that the log is done only if the logging filter enables it.

    • logBehaviorStart

      public void logBehaviorStart​(Behavior c, Behavior n)
      Logs the change of a behavior of an actor and the starting of its initialization.
      Parameters:
      c - the current behavior.
      n - the new behavior. Note that the log is done only if the logging filter enables it.

    • logBehaviorInit

      public void logBehaviorInit​(Behavior b, Long t)
      Logs the end of the initialization of a behavior.
      Parameters:
      b - the current behavior.
      t - the behavior initialization end time. Note that the log is done only if the logging filter enables it.

    • logStateChange

      public void logStateChange​(Behavior b, BehaviorState s)
      Logs the change of state of the behavior of an actor.
      Parameters:
      b - the current behavior.
      s - the new behavior state. Note that the log is done only if the logging filter enables it.

    • logOutputMessage

      public void logOutputMessage​(Behavior b, Message m)
      Logs the sending of a message.
      Parameters:
      b - the sender behavior.
      m - the message. Note that the log is done only if the logging filter enables it.

    • logMessageProcessing

      public void logMessageProcessing​(Behavior b, MessagePattern p, Message m)
      Logs the starting of the processing of a message.
      Parameters:
      b - the behavior.
      p - the message pattern.
      m - the message. Note that the log is done only if the logging filter enables it.

    • logMessageProcessed

      public void logMessageProcessed​(Behavior b, MessagePattern p, Message m, long t)
      Logs the end of the processing of a message.
      Parameters:
      b - the behavior.
      p - the message pattern.
      m - the message.
      t - the processing time. Note that the log is done only if the logging filter enables it.

    • logUnmatchedMessage

      public void logUnmatchedMessage​(Behavior b, Message m)
      Logs the a message when it does not match any behavior pattern.
      Parameters:
      b - the behavior.
      m - the message. Note that the log is done only if the logging filter enables it.

    • logActorShutdown

      public void logActorShutdown​(Behavior b)
      Logs the shutdown of an actor.
      Parameters:
      b - the behavior. Note that the log is done only if the logging filter enables it.

    • logEndExecution

      public void logEndExecution​(long t)
      Logs the end time of the execution of the actor space and computes the duration of the execution. Moreover, it logs the number of actors created during the execution of the actor space.
      Parameters:
      t - the execution starting time. Note that the log is done only if the logging filter enables it.

    • logStep

      public void logStep​(long t)
      Logs the time when a clock event is sent and the number of actors running in the actor space.
      Parameters:
      t - the execution time. Note that the log is done only if the logging filter enables it.

    • logDataLoading

      public void logDataLoading​(String n, String f)
      Logs information about the loading of data from a file.
      Parameters:
      n - the name of the class that loads data.
      f - the input file path. Note that the log is done only if the logging filter enables it.

    • logDataSaving

      public void logDataSaving​(String n, String f)
      Logs information about the saving of data into a file.
      Parameters:
      n - the name of the class that saves data.
      f - the output file path. Note that the log is done only if the logging filter enables it.

    • logRuntime

      public void logRuntime​(int f, String c, String n, Object o, Object... p)
      Logs the execution of a runtime component.
      Parameters:
      f - the runtime filter flag.
      c - the runtime component class qualified name.
      n - the runtime method name.
      o - the runtime method result.
      p - the runtime method parameters. Note that the log is done only if the logging filter enables it.

    • file

      public static File file​(String p, String e)
      Builds a new file where store data.
      Parameters:
      p - the file path.
      e - the file extension.
      Returns:
      the file. Note that if the file directory is represented by a relative path, then it is considered a sub-directory of the logging repository. This method allows to create different files from the same file path. It is possible because it concatenates the file names with incremental numbers starting from zero.
